Hello,

On 15/09/06, Gordon Mohr <gojomo@...> wrote:
>  > I would like to have a crawl job that won't end when there is nothing
>  > more to crawl, but just sit there and wait for any JMX injected URIs.
>  > Somethink like the AdaptiveRevitsFrontier, but with a BdbFrontier (so,
>  > I can use JMX). Any clue how to do it?
>
>  You could try the 'pause-at-finish' option. Then, after adding new URIs,
>  you'd have to also unpause the crawl.
>
>  As it stands now, an crawl with no pending URIs must either terminate or
>  pause. (If it pauses, and you unpause it without adding URIs, it will
>  terminate.)

Superb, sorry that I missed it in the settings.

Thanks,
--
